<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Live Ammunition](/Feats.aspx?ID=3227) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 129</row>

**Archetype** [Artillerist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=115)

</column>

---

There are generally few things as ill-advised as being shot out of a cannon or launched by a trebuchet, but people use the tactic every so often in a desperate situation. While it's more humane to use this strategy with mindless [constructs](/Traits.aspx?ID=35) or [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), occasionally an exceedingly foolhardy adventurer demands the opportunity to try it. Loading a creature requires two additional [Load](/Rules.aspx?ID=1624) actions, which you must conduct personally. The creature must be willing, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38), or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) throughout the process, and the [siege weapon](/equipment/siege-weapons) must be physically capable of firing the creature in question, based on their size and shape. Typically, that means ballistas don't qualify, for example—nor do auto-catapults which require specifically-sized balls—but normal catapults and onagers work just fine. When you [Launch](/Rules.aspx?ID=1626) the weapon, if the weapon usually targets an area, you target a single 5-foot square instead. The siege weapon deals its normal damage to its target, or to the modified area, and to the creature fired.
name: Live Ammunition
